Quick search

Welcome to Chessao’s documentation!¶

Chessao is a combination of chess and mao. See the sources here.

Indices and tables¶

  • Index
  • Module Index
  • Search Page

Cards¶

class chessao.cards.Card(color, ranga)¶

Card class.

The CARDS_COLORS variable is a dictionary:

CARDS_COLORS = {1: '♤', 2: '♡', 3: '♢', 4: '♧'}

Each card has two attributes: color and rank.

You would construct a two of spades with Card(1, '2')

class chessao.cards.Deck(lista_kart=None)¶

A Deck of cards class.

Holds one attribute (‘cards’) with a list of cards in order.

deal(n=1)¶

Return a list of top n cards.

>>> Deck(lista_kart=[Card(1,'5')]).deal()
[5♤]
get_card_index(rank='5', suit=1)¶

Return the index of a specified card.

tasuj(until=None)¶

Shuffle the deck.

Chess¶

class chessao.chess.Board(rnd=False, fenrep=False)¶

Chess Board class.

fen()¶

Return a FEN representation of a board.

>>> Board().fen()
'RNBQKBNR/PPPPPPPP/8/8/8/8/pppppppp/rnbqkbnr KQkq - 0 0'
get_points(col)¶

Returns a sum of points for pieces of color col

>>> Board().get_points('b') > 49
True
pod_biciem(pole, color)¶

Return True if a position is under attack.

>>> Board(fenrep='R3K2R/8/8/8/8/8/8/8').pod_biciem(88,'b')
False
>>> Board(fenrep='R3K2R/8/8/8/8/8/8/8').pod_biciem(35,'c')
True
>>> Board(fenrep='b3K2R/8/8/8/8/8/8/8').pod_biciem(32,'b')
True
>>> Board(fenrep='N3K2R/8/8/8/8/8/8/8').pod_biciem(33,'c')
True
>>> Board(fenrep='R3K2R/8/8/8/8/8/8/8').pod_biciem(81,'c')
True
>>> Board(fenrep='R3K2R/P7/8/8/8/8/8/8').pod_biciem(42,'c')
True
rusz(c, d=None, karta=5♤, only_bool=False)¶

Move a piece on a board function

>>> Board(fenrep='R3K2R/8/8/8/8/8/8/8').rusz('E1','B1')
True
>>> Board(fenrep='R3K2R/8/8/pP6/8/NnrRqQbB/8/7k').rusz('E1','G1')
True
>>> Board(fenrep='R3K2R/8/8/Q7/8/8/8/8').rusz('A4','A1', Card(1,'Q'))
True
>>> Board(fenrep='R3K2R/8/8/P7/8/8/8/8').rusz('A4','A5', Card(1,'Q'))
True
>>> Board(fenrep='R3K2R/8/8/P7/q7/8/8/8').rusz('A5','A4', Card(1,'6'))
True
>>> Board(fenrep='R3K2R/8/8/P7/q7/8/1N6/8').rusz('B7','A5', Card(1,'6'))
True
>>> b = Board()
>>> b.rusz('D2','D4')
True
>>> b.rusz('A7','A6')
True
>>> b.rusz('D4', 'D5')
True
>>> b.rusz('E7','E5')
True
>>> b.rusz('D5','E6')
True
>>> b.rusz('A6','A5')
True
>>> b.rusz('A5', 'A4')
True
>>> b.rusz('B2','B4')
True
>>> b.rusz('A4','B3')
True
>>> b.rusz('H2', 'H5', only_bool=True)
Traceback (most recent call last):
...
ValueError: BŁĄD w funkcji rusz! skad H2 dokad H5 karta 5♤ mvs 0, enpas 300

Gameplay¶

class chessao.gameplay.GameplayEncoder(skipkeys=False, ensure_ascii=True, check_circular=True, allow_nan=True, sort_keys=False, indent=None, separators=None, default=None)¶

A JSON encoder class for Gameplay object.

chessao.gameplay.resurect(history, gameplay=None)¶

Create a Gameplay object from a history.

class chessao.gameplay.rozgrywka(rnd=1, fenrep=False, auto=True, ovr=False, test=False)¶

A gameplay class.

card_ok_to_play(crd)¶

# if card is to be burned its always ok to play it

check_card(n, r, cl=None)¶

# check if card played n turns ago has a rank==ran (and color = col) # if card was burned returns False

check_if_move(n)¶

# check if n turnes ago there was a move made # if true this means three possible scenarios happened - kspades,ace or # lost turn

cofnij(color, ruch)¶

Reverese the move .

czy_pat(k)¶

Return True if there is a stalemate.

czy_szach(k)¶

Return True if color k is checked.

from_history_get_card(n)¶

# returns a card played n turns AGO

get_card(ovr=None)¶

First stage of a move: getting a card from a player.

get_gracz(k)¶

Return a player who has pieces of color k.

get_move(ovr=None)¶

Second stage of a move: get a chess move.

graj(video=False)¶

play a game untill there is stalemate or checkmate.

move(card, where)¶

Make an actual move.

possible_moves(color, okzbi=True, kar=5♤, burned=False, flag=(0, ))¶

Return a dict of possible moves.

przetasuj()¶

Reshuffle the deck.

snapshot(jsn=True, remove=None)¶

Return a JSON representation of a current state.

what_happened()¶

this function is parsing the history to make sense of the situation. returns ints that code a situation. 0 = nothing special, 1 = turn loosing, 2 - king of spades, 3 - king of hearts, 4 - jack

Helpers¶

exception chessao.helpers.ChessaoGameplayError(message, gameplay, errors=None)¶

Custom gameplay error

chessao.helpers.czy_pion_na_koncu(brd, k)¶

Returns True if a Pawn reached the end of Board.

>>> czy_pion_na_koncu(Board(), 'b')
0
>>> czy_pion_na_koncu(Board(), 'c')
0
>>> czy_pion_na_koncu(Board(), 'f')
Traceback (most recent call last):
...
AssertionError
chessao.helpers.deal(deck, override=None, number=5)¶

Deal for #number cads to each player.

Returns a tuple with two lists and Deck object. Override parameter specifies the hands for players.

chessao.helpers.decode_card(card_str)¶

Parse card for gameflow

>>> decode_card('!10♡')
(1, [10♡])
>>> decode_card('J♡;R')
(0, [J♡], 'Rook')
chessao.helpers.decode_card_color(card_str)¶

return integer repr of a color

>>> decode_card_color('♡')
2
>>> decode_card_color('sth')
Traceback (most recent call last):
...
ValueError: incorrect card sring: sth
chessao.helpers.invert_color(color)¶

Return the other color.

>>> invert_color('c')
'b'
>>> invert_color('b')
'c'
>>> invert_color('sth')
'b'
chessao.helpers.ktora_kupka(karta, kupki, rnd=False)¶

Return the index of a pile wherein the card goes. Expects a list with a card, and a list of two Deck objects.

>>> ktora_kupka([Card(1,'5')], ([Card(1,'9')],[Card(3, 'K')]))
0
>>> ktora_kupka([Card(1,'5')], ([Card(1,'9')],[Card(2, 'K')]))
0
>>> ktora_kupka([Card(4,'2')], ([Card(1,'9')],[Card(2, 'K')]))
Traceback (most recent call last):
...
ValueError: card: [2♧] kupki ([9♤], [K♡])
chessao.helpers.last_line_check(color, first_sq, last_sq, board)¶

Return the position of the Piece in the last row, if none return 0.

chessao.helpers.nawaleta(jack_str)¶

# this should be depracated Map the jack choice to a Piece Class.

>>> nawaleta('p')
'Pawn'
chessao.helpers.odejmij(hand, cards)¶

Return hand after removing the specified cards from it.

>>> odejmij([Card(1,'7'), Card(4,'5')], [Card(1,'7')])
[5♧]
>>> odejmij([Card(1,'7'), Card(4,'5')], [Card(2,'7')])
Traceback (most recent call last):
...
ValueError: The card(s) is(are) not in the hand.
chessao.helpers.ok_karta(card, decks)¶

Returns True if a card is can be put on one of a decks

>>> ok_karta([Card(1,'5')], ([Card(1,'9')],[Card(3, 'K')]))
True
>>> ok_karta([Card(1,'5'), Card(2,'7')], ([Card(1,'9')],[Card(3, 'K')]))
False
chessao.helpers.rozpakuj_input(inp)¶
>>> rozpakuj_input('24')
[2♧]
>>> rozpakuj_input('104')
[10♧]
>>> rozpakuj_input('!A4')
[A♧]
>>> rozpakuj_input('54,64,74')
[5♧, 6♧, 7♧]
rozpakuj_input('54,64')
[5♧]
chessao.helpers.schodki_check(card_list)¶

Check if “card stairs” are build correctly.

>>> c = Card
>>> schodki_check([c(1,'6'),c(1,'7'),c(2,'7')])
True
>>> schodki_check([c(1,'2'),c(2,'3')])
False
>>> schodki_check([c(1,'7'),c(1,'6'),c(1,'5')])
True
>>> schodki_check([c(3,'6'),c(1,'6'),c(2,'6'),c(2,'6'),c(4,'6')])
True
>>> schodki_check([c(2,'2'),c(1,'2'),c(1,'3')])
False
>>> schodki_check([c(2,'3'),c(1,'3'),c(4,'3')])
True
>>> schodki_check([c(2,'6'),c(2,'7'),c(3,'7'),c(3,'6')])
True
chessao.helpers.str_to_card(str_card)¶

Return a Card obj from a string representation.

>>> str_to_card('102')
10♡
>>> str_to_card('!102')
10♡

Pieces¶

class chessao.pieces.Piece(color, position, name, val, mvs=0)¶

A chess piece abstract class.

moves(card, board)¶

Return a list of positions that a piece can move onto, on a specific card & board

Players¶

Players classes

class chessao.players.Player(ida, kol, reka=None, bot=True, name='gracz')¶

A player abstract class.

choose_card(talie, plansza)¶

Returns a card from player hand.

choose_move(d, plansza, karta)¶

Select a move out ou a board.

choose_prom()¶

Choose a promotion for pawn at the end of the board.
